name: Malonic acid
desc: Malonic acid (IUPAC systematic name: propanedioic acid) is a dicarboxylic acid with structure CH2(COOH)2. The ionized form of malonic acid, as well as its esters and salts, are known as malonates. For example, diethyl malonate is malonic acid's diethyl ester. The name originates from the Greek word μᾶλον (malon) meaning 'apple'.

images.alt: Ball-and-stick model of the malonic acid molecule

Related carboxylic acids:
acetic acid
oxalic acid
propionic acid
tartronic acid
acrylic acid
butyric acid

fumaric acid
